alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 9:29AM PST until December 20 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades, mainly north of Santiam Canyon. * WHEN...Until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will be lowest near the Columbia Gorge at around 500-1500 feet. Meanwhile, snow levels will generally remain above 5000 feet south of Santiam Canyon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
